document.title: California Common Core State Standards: English Language Arts and Literacy

1FB613E873014283BF73F197B1D141C3.description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

B5FBAB2311704F77935D67F5B502D2C5.description: Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

EAA6A8821C2C4EFABFBB5494FC32501C.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better understand each of the words.

7646F23BE1B84750A0FBD956C0E83D5A.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary, biblical, and mythological allusions) in context.

2CFD5E9F8BF9434B879ED80A3676CB35.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

48154925838441E19795E3D80A153A8B.description: Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

E27F776D0B1A4795AF583597E1A287D4.description: Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech or trace the etymology of words.

816E6532694D4A0986044E264906AA79.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., belligerent, bellicose, rebel).

A1FFF6B075E54DE88F2FF64DA5C90ACB.description: Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word's position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

6C2E9ACA3B10461BB5578775833FDA9A.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

78665EF2FAA94751803640BFB99CDEE8.description: Choose language that expresses ideas precisely and concisely, recognizing and eliminating wordiness and redundancy.

D127B9D8008E4103A4CEC94890720788.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

6CED12863BDF492A88D5F85C55E231F8.description: Use a comma to separate coordinate adjectives (e.g., It was a fascinating, enjoyable movie but not He wore an old[,] green shirt).

6C0613E7939642D78497937CE9A8B407.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

34B891A6EFA14811B8B4637BAD753813.description: Place phrases and clauses within a sentence, recognizing and correcting misplaced and dangling modifiers.

78B3B29CE16A48FF9A417C0069403B99.description: Choose among simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to signal differing relationships among ideas.

99B913CC95A14A3196B1DDBC8EE1BE53.description: Explain the function of phrases and clauses in general and their function in specific sentences.

1AB20611BB3646CBBDB1B481E8237E05.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

765C2EC8D32846B9932C2CAA5BEBB60B.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

A2BADED096BE429DBF6092C22D1480B6.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

7A558D8A88BD40E485945978813AC0AB.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

108A354B3EB541CABD096D90548A53E0.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

26E21CDADB274B1EA33240E7441AE4F8.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

A44B1962E4DB4E75A41CA4C272AEBAEB.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

6A330468385847EB8AE6AADEF10296EB.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

035C5A77B219429EAFE14AA4CA5EB4B4.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

7FD8414F04954B03BF55B62DEEEF2163.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

D886365FD55E4AC78A62C76566F11DFB.description: Include multimedia components and visual displays in presentations to clarify claims and findings and emphasize salient points.

7701DBBE9A8646CEA4C105D290A7E531.description: Plan and present an argument that: supports a claim, acknowledges counterarguments, organizes evidence logically, uses words and phrases to create cohesion, and provides a concluding statement that supports the argument presented.

365707B0729A450FB02F91C9EDEE3DF0.description: Present claims and findings (e.g., argument, narrative, summary presentations), emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with pertinent descriptions, facts, details, and examples; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

3EDDFF04CFD74B8F9ECBC5E9C575B492.description: Delineate a speaker's argument and specific claims, and attitude toward the subject, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

A316B3F6D7114F11870014E4D866EE45.description: Analyze the main ideas and supporting details presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and explain how the ideas clarify a topic, text, or issue under study.

BADA718A02AB43F08463AECE2ECA0C9E.description: Acknowledge new information expressed by others and, when warranted, modify their own views.

A37A8F8EA33C41D89D69C9164587BACC.description: Pose questions that elicit elaboration and respond to others' questions and comments with relevant observations and ideas that bring the discussion back on topic as needed.

06B573FA8AD14CE7B0DFE787DF53F6D0.description: Follow rules for collegial discussions, track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

FB298A14B0AD4BF192DCED283C00B04A.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

62A08F72F51E4DE59AB558F7554B9A5A.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 7 topics, texts, and issues, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly.

F36B3CD0311E41FDADEBFB0B87A48994.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

7DAFA8FB805141A0ADCF768B1851D1CE.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

956C0EE0F79B4B5F8C8A7DA8ACA365A6.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

BFA39E878FCC4A5F916F34BB089BDDCA.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

02E8F87E975A47D3B13C76D99D8AF39C.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

D902A6D570794BBA8D9B7BE144AC7883.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

E65E624A654742FC9B7622DA370A6A2F.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

3E66095987224A54A6EF67BFA257CDF8.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for reflection and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

4666BA2879B141E18F60EFC9EC9D5466.description: Draw evidence from informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

E5FF8E767EBD492C8B3D24EB09B447FF.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

FD9B5E4A83C744EFBFC59F44C06B34A1.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question), drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions that allow for multiple avenues of exploration.

38CACDE15B2445C7A22B07DA80D762AA.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

48BC798A3DBC4B849050CC480A99CB7F.description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.

06D08E7A553C4EF59BDB403EBBFB54F8.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and present the relationships between information and ideas clearly and efficiently.

2C78D68E92C04E4AA73B925A6E899A8F.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

AA025D86A956484D929B8658C84CDCA9.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

9FE5BC4F9E5E417B90A24EC0D30494B1.description: Establish and maintain a formal style and objective tone.

C9491D443BDC4B31ABA486FC3709ACF7.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

D57F6576BBDF4276BADD52527F2491F9.description: Use appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

EE9288A754E8424B937F8E9D8EA8113B.description: Develop the topic with relevant, well-chosen facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

975C8384983B4EEA952039230640D67C.description: Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader categories as appropriate to achieving purpose; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

09A319B4D0A545468743D6B0E6B43E32.description: Write informative/explanatory texts, including the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/ experiments, or technical processes.

C7C2879EAF3A42FCB97D63919DB45E60.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from or supports the argument presented.

FCF10E63DB0F46D785CB1A81C67FB63C.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

F037E8E805E74446B74AE37EA1F21CC6.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence.

7C3A081CF53B4599B8CDABDB5BECA7DA.description: Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant, accurate data and evidence that demonstrate an understanding of the topic or text, using credible sources.

06293E71C60D4461A636E34C4C0B7BAA.description: Introduce claim(s) about a topic or issue, acknowledge and distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

99D01EE4E0D04260813B410D6B19C557.description: Write arguments focused on discipline-specific content.

B728C508AC784EFDAEBB716C7B6125CF.description: Writing Standards for Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects 6â€”12

3EF159F2AD2C400787663D865818F5CF.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

64FB1C451BF94B3191D49E928D143165.description: Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g. "Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims").

20D839EC7E87483F984ADEE350359ADB.description: Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literature (e.g., "Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history").

0E9D5E55D76B4E56A66135D49A7FC199.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

B86C5ACB58974E70A818D96015DCDAFC.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

A7E34CAC40604632A0C454444071A62A.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions for further research and investigation.

5E101B25D87E4803B7A74990A81DB0E5.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

EE9EE470575A47AFBDFB779F1CF736B6.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and link to and cite sources as well as to interact and collaborate with others, including linking to and citing sources.

9873051B2EEB4275912DA0A5400C7CA6.description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.

2A57A93F2E234CD38CB4321FF668C560.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

09DEF29B70034661905687AACA7B765E.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

266956AA3F7A482EA23C69729B90BFDD.description: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events.

95218A43170B4466BCB4D6B331B213C7.description: Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

F95AE5A5A4134B25AB3B0C74EA0BDF58.description: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

34543F6366A24B3A8EA2522F74944897.description: Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

2F49474D54B14B898F459B6C6513FC1C.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

C70864F105B14E09911D7BE0963B2489.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented

61E03365F5CB401082E10475DCB50D0A.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

9E8D15D1218A41EBA5E9A9884572AB92.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

F0FF9A60348C4E4CA3C6A9E2B90548B9.description: Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

05C49518DAB54F7DB91AD5A2A83E6E93.description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

7763FD20B09246C18257CF3F59B3B272.description: Introduce a topic or thesis statement clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/ effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

B54F9E404E6145A4A89701DCD9168261.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content

47282924F4B44321A5AFAA4D05AAB5CE.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

BB89B8F0BD2342E59885C9FA2CF432B0.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

BCF0BAC8F3404670A43A6AFE2253F5C5.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), reasons, and evidence.

B27760D4079747238E02C1E766D3D7FC.description: Support claim(s) or counterarguments with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

9A8292C481674D6DA2424F04279FFA8A.description: Introduce claim(s), acknowledge and address alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

2AF69511429642E5B2CE2F22113E6A4A.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

8567F6035CC94B93B19708BD6E431433.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

4D27C251D0BA443BAD983595392BF8CF.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

5573115113B245B087F0F62105A27286.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

4D6E6E6925584181B3B34D6A9E24D1CB.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

128F464684E641E39DEBE3A4FE0A0A92.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

ADB12DD7530A4092B5BD1C69CB8FF91E.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

B82B9AFF61B84C09ABC0D9BC65A43EF3.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

D744317A13494A0F8B6A3CA9D27E86CA.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

571393C69E154C60B86C24F445A3703D.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

5E440F67E9CA41DABE7A4651064AC5C9.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

DEE46A8384E44882A24E5524A8EAECAD.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

29944841140F4F1C9E86688C28314028.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

FFEAF80BE55E47DE95FF4E894ABC92BE.description: By the end of grade 8, read and comprehend science/technical texts in the grades 6â€”8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

22CA65C2D58249388B5A9836E82FE5B9.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

E959535DD6F8498A90021DB71628509B.description: Compare and contrast the information gained from experiments, simulations, video, or multimedia sources with that gained from reading a text on the same topic.

CF7929804A75472D9DC1EE1E9F98DCAD.description: Distinguish among facts, reasoned judgment based on research findings, and speculation in a text.

BF7154B0FC8C45AC90601720245FAABC.description: Integrate quantitative or technical information expressed in words in a text with a version of that information expressed visually (e.g., in a flowchart, diagram, model, graph, or table).

CF606540BB5146D394294126A996551B.description: Analyze the author's purpose in providing an explanation, describing a procedure, or discussing an experiment in a text.

7A5EECB6E8694AEBA6F4B852019AABE1.description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to an understanding of the topic.

A00584386103443E9E81D72FFA425613.description: Determine the meaning of symbols, key terms, and other domain-specific words and phrases as they are used in a specific scientific or technical context relevant to grades 6â€”8 texts and topics.

3463441F21DC4E838DA1896EB5419E4B.description: Follow precisely a multistep procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks.

C30A64B9D9CE4318884838557E747513.description: Determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; provide an accurate summary of the text distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

F33E5D058A38470EA66467C4DCBFF361.description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts.

CA2013AB942340E083FF6E3C600347BE.description: Reading Standards for Literacy in Science and Technical Subjects 6â€”12

AE2FA6C18C1F49B5B572DE1817A9B7EB.description: By the end of grade 8, read and comprehend history/social studies texts in the grades 6â€”8 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

723D4D63B6D94825B5027021A008E3B4.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

FA2207399D314247A956D3B20C47F545.description: Analyze the relationship between a primary and secondary source on the same topic.

4692BFB4BFA549E88A8C9A5FCA3AF6AB.description: Distinguish among fact, opinion, and reasoned judgment in a text.

C943B314E0B84BA0A93473FEF1A534D4.description: Integrate visual information (e.g., in charts, graphs, photographs, videos, or maps) with other information in print and digital texts.

0E2E12158745466688AAC31C84C17C6A.description: Identify aspects of a text that reveal an author's point of view or purpose (e.g., loaded language, inclusion or avoidance of particular facts).

6D4EB08761CF4ADFAD5CB43FECA81031.description: Describe how a text presents information (e.g., sequentially, comparatively, causally).

2DED65E8F1604A61A4A8044469B75627.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including vocabulary specific to domains related to history/social studies.

BFEA29AA8A224D16AA14471EDFD6BA1E.description: Identify key steps in a text's description of a process related to history/social studies (e.g., how a bill becomes law, how interest rates are raised or lowered).

BB3456F0234C4F4D909975C6A317D76F.description: Determine the central ideas or information of a primary or secondary source; provide an accurate summary of the source distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

0F4AEC56EFC448589A6F6E7880FB7818.description: Cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources.

294143420CB0449CB386A1BEE811D6DF.description: Reading Standards for Literacy in History/Social Studies 6â€”12

ECA7C65F5203452587BB7C3D7D3E9B76.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6â€“8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

EC320452A9FE4FB785F7023F705FAC9A.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

D174F6903FA74346A94D119351532B26.description: Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts.

227F5204650D49C9A5F97039D22D8F28.description: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

C598B933F881449FA887FADE2AF297C2.description: Compare and contrast a text to an audio, video, or multimedia version of the text, analyzing each medium's portrayal of the subject (e.g., how the delivery of a speech affects the impact of the words).

E78B2E41374445BD993B9C9CB35B4D33.description: Determine an author's point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author distinguishes his or her position from that of others.

9F2EAF9C723B4B938BBC3BC691160222.description: Analyze the use of text features (e.g., graphics, headers, captions) in public documents.

FBE5F419AA7842B48DAAF40365B86D55.description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to the development of the ideas.

824215F4F3F64E40A98EB62D50F063D0.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone. (See grade 7 Language standards 4â€“6 for additional expectations.)

B1FC3EDE98F94489A318115B03997A69.description: Analyze the interactions between individuals, events, and ideas in a text (e.g., how ideas influence individuals or events, or how individuals influence ideas or events).

755935DC359E4798B7E4B93DD8DF8F28.description: Determine two or more central ideas in a text and analyze their development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

AA574773176543D09D38DFCC03241A9B.description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

8344A875583C486493D56AA508610AC2.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6â€“8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

C327465C2B09436486E44DE074A28268.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

4207273064134F7FBC380C4751189502.description: Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history.

A6E73957709A495B8DAE232C5C88FDB0.description: Compare and contrast a written story, drama, or poem to its audio, filmed, staged, or multimedia version, analyzing the effects of techniques unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and angles in a film).

F19BC4C716EF42D8B7DA080088CAE219.description: Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters or narrators in a text.

F7BA872274924D04842A9547CE65E5FC.description: Analyze how a drama's or poem's form or structure (e.g., soliloquy, sonnet) contributes to its meaning.

D326107A20E04A6CB83FDCE9E637A7F8.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of sounds (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or stanza of a poem or section of a story or drama. (See grade 7 Language standards 4â€“6 for additional expectations.)

A655A5386B47448E864EE0DE68ACEDD1.description: Analyze how particular elements of a story or drama interact (e.g., how setting shapes the characters or plot).

1D74F2D4C8AF4E5C977542BDCBA49E17.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text; provide an objective summary of the text.

55FD418ABC444E939E3F82C6BEDCCEE3.description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

57959A0BAD7A4246B5E27F60CEEE04A0.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

7D4B53D6C3EE4377A021C289F12B7E49.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

4F51211BF5484524862B7ACDEF315B2A.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

40EBF93AA79545CB80259D169C077EF1.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

73CE5884C2BB4C1AB07D5970D8FBC36C.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.
comments: Please see "Research to Build and Present Knowledge" in Writing and "Comprehension and Collaboration" in Speaking and Listening for additional standards relevant to gathering, assessing, and applying information from print and digital sources.

7F46DAE74EB94EDD85B391CAB91C50D7.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

B0211592BF974ADD93F871CD9767B2A9.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

0E2E7E973C0D4DE587B0E34EB227F028.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

E10F4DC409B9482BB48B84E5520687F6.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

BD4DBFDD9700420CB47E2510A253C752.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

51A445A61CAB4F4D812F9CE2460DA56A.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

55A9041EFDC74D0D949F4192DDEADA7C.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
